Articles.Content: I propose to share the remains of the wall
@Wildcat111 and I are sharing the crumbles.

**\*1578 decibels\*****\*obsene word\* you!**

My blasted crumbles

**\*1578 decibels\*****How dare you you!**

[@HansonKerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/185809-hansonkerman/) and I's crumbles
I fortify the crumbles. Still our crumbles.
Crumblefort under siege.

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, kerbiloid said:
> 
> 
> Crumblefort under siege.
> 

um, no! I blast you're crumbles with 14 M.O.A.Bs and build a fort covered in carbyne and other ultra strong materials, and defended by 4345 Extremely powerful railguns!

The crumbles fall down, back to the crater. 14 MOABs got wasted.

A mouse has cut the power cable.

Your 4345 Extremely powerful railguns are out of power.

The Crumblefort has risen from the ~~ashes~~ crumbles.
[@Wildcat111](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/165926-wildcat111/) and I use my portal gun and his planes to retake Crumblefort.

> 
> 
> On 3/27/2020 at 8:17 PM, HansonKerman said:
> 
> 
> [@Wildcat111](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/165926-wildcat111/) and I use my portal gun and his planes to retake Crumblefort.
> 

I decrease the temperature in the fort from zero to 5000000 degrees celsius in 2 seconds, and back to 77 degrees fahrenheit. I surround the solid surface with an indestructible material, and protect it with 392849 high powered lasers. the entire fort is made out of nanobots, controlled by conscious hyper intelligent AI named bob that decided to participate in the game, that is made of the same nanobots. even the air is made of nanobots that kill anything that gets inside, that isn't supposed to be inside.

**MINE**

well technically it's owned by bob.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-04-03T16:05:16Z" title="04/03/2020 04:05  PM" data-short="4 yr">April 3, 2020</time> by Dirkidirk**

A solar (kerbolar?) flare suddenly erupts from Kerbol.  8 minutes later the EMP fries all of your fancy dancy gadgets.  I walk in and build a mud hut out of piles of microscopic dead nanobots.

My dead-nanobot mud hut in the middle of Crumble Crater.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-04-03T16:35:07Z" title="04/03/2020 04:35  PM" data-short="4 yr">April 3, 2020</time> by RoninFrog**

>

> 
> 
> A solar (kerbolar?) flare suddenly erupts from Kerbol.  8 minutes later the EMP fries all of your fancy dancy gadgets.  I walk in and build a mud hut out of piles of microscopic dead nanobots.
>

> My dead-nanobot mud hut in the middle of Crumble Crater.
> 

The Crumble Crater crumbles.

The planet’s hill.
I build two more mud huts out of dead nanobots.  Crumbled Crater Village is small and primitive but growing.
I rebuild Bob to obey our commands. Bob and I have joined Crumbled Crater Village

The void stares back.

Black crumbs of the crumbled crumble crater w/ crumble crumble village, placed inside a crumbling ~~crumbcible~~ crucible.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-04-03T20:23:54Z" title="04/03/2020 08:23  PM" data-short="4 yr">April 3, 2020</time> by Fraston**
I turn the crucible off and turn it into a metal hut.  Crumble Crater Village now has a bomb shelter.
as none of you explicitly stated ownership of Crumble Crater Village, still ours.

I make a fence with fenceposts made from barrels of [@Dirkidirk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/200064-dirkidirk/)'s laser cannons and fence in a herd of nearby cows.  My and [@HansonKerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/185809-hansonkerman/)'s Crumble Crater Village, now with a cattle farm.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-04-04T01:59:28Z" title="04/04/2020 01:59  AM" data-short="4 yr">April 4, 2020</time> by RoninFrog**

I observe

not menacing enough

Here is a map of Crumble Crater Village:

![wt9TjrT.jpg](https://imgur.com/wt9TjrT.jpg)

And yes, I dug a well.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-04-04T05:35:31Z" title="04/04/2020 05:35  AM" data-short="4 yr">April 4, 2020</time> by RoninFrog**
  
Better Picture
Bob and his nanobots now have guns. Also I love that pic

> 
> 
> 16 hours ago, RoninFrog said:
> 
> 
> Here is a map of Crumble Crater Village:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [![wt9TjrT.jpg](https://imgur.com/wt9TjrT.jpg)](https://imgur.com/wt9TjrT.jpg "Enlarge image")
> 
> 
> 
> 
> And yes, I dug a well.
> 

Nice!

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, HansonKerman said:
> 
> 
> Bob and his nanobots now have guns. Also I love that pic
> 

I think some nice obsidian-tipped spears would be a lot more practical in the eyes of a humble villager.

The well-digging project wasn't going so *well* (he he he) as all my efforts to bore through [@Dirkidirk](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/200064-dirkidirk/)'s indestructible foundation were in vain.  The well was abandoned and I hitched up a couple oxen from the cattle farm and plowed me some irrigation ditches.  The recent nearby lava floes had fertilized the soil quite nicely so I planted a corn field.

The plowing was still difficult as I kept turning over old, rusty warheads from some recent bombings.  But eventually I got the land cleared and put all the warheads in a pile outside the crater rim.

![pygKy7X.jpg](https://imgur.com/pygKy7X.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2020-04-05T00:04:53Z" title="04/05/2020 12:04  AM" data-short="4 yr">April 5, 2020</time> by RoninFrog**

Decoy Irrigation Ditch activated. Anyone who touches it disentigrates. Bob initiates

\*nanobot\_ airstrike\_initiate

\*my name is bob

There is a rumor going around the village that the northernmost irrigation ditch is poisoned.  Rumor has it that one of the villagers was hoeing the cornfield for whatever reason people hoe cornfields, when he noticed that "the big brown cow with the big brown horns" (which doesn't help identify which cow it was at all) had escaped the cattle farm and "wandered into yonder ditch.  Ah wuz watchin'im and makin' to catchim again, but then 'e just splodered into a million bits!"

Now the villagers will have nothing to do with the "pizened wadder" in the northernmost irrigation ditch and won't go anywhere near it.

Edit: I am kind of picturing the villagers as similar to the people in the "burn the witch" scene from Monty Python's the Holy Grail.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-04-05T01:03:25Z" title="04/05/2020 01:03  AM" data-short="4 yr">April 5, 2020</time> by RoninFrog**
